title: Woman in Boris Johnson's seat has brilliantly angry response to hearing his name
text:

Boris Johnson makes lots of us cross.

Some of us don't like the ways he's lied and misled the public. Others dislike his threat to defy the law over Brexit. And some fear conflicts of interest in his personal life.

But for this woman, the mere mention of the Prime Minister's name was enough to send her flying into a grump.

The unknown woman was approached by Sky News in the Tory leader's own constituency of Uxbridge and South Ruislip.

Interviewer Sophy Ridge didn't even have the chance to finish her question before the woman scowled: "Don't you ever mention that name in front of me, that filthy piece of toerag!"

And then she stomped off.

(Image: SKY)

As is expected these days, the unknown woman was of course instantly hailed as a hero by some on social media.

The comedian and writer Mark Steel said: "Oh someone give that lady a series on BBC1 and a Netflix special."

Journalist Charles McLellan added: "When you're expecting a typical gammony 'get it done' vox pop, and you get this. Brilliant."

Twitter user "ifartinbed" declared: "I imagine the Queen says exactly the same."

(Image: SKY)

(Image: SKY)

Twitter user Gareth Thomas added: "He’s not even the whole toe-rag. Brilliant!"

Of course, it's not the first time the Prime Minister has inspired strong emotions among the public.

Last month a man in Morley, Leeds, shook the Prime Minister's hand and politely asked him: "Please leave my town." He replied: "I will. Very soon."

Boris Johnson was also confronted in Whipps Cross Hospital, north London, by furious dad Omar Salem who said his daughter had nearly died due to an understaffed NHS.

But it's still not a patch on the best political vox pop of all time, Brenda from Bristol - who was asked for her views on the 2017 snap election.

To be fair to the PM, it wasn't all bad for him on Sky News' trip to Uxbridge town centre.

One woman said he was the "right person for the job" in an "impossible situation".

Another voter said: "I think he's doing alright. I voted for him last election and I'll probably do it again this year."

(Image: PA Wire/PA Images)

But another voter said even her six-year-old has recognised the flaws of the PM. She told Sky News: "I don't think much but I know what my daughter thinks - that he's a silly man."

Left-wing Labour campaign group Momentum have launched a local bid to oust the Prime Minister from his seat in any snap election.

He won a majority of just 5,034 in 2017, unusually small for a Prime Minister, after Labour's vote in Uxbridge and South Ruislip surged by nearly 14%.
description: The mystery woman spoke for one side of a divided nation as she scowled the PM is a "filthy piece of toerag"
